posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
Not many builds with this class grouping. And none that divvy it up like I thought to. 

Elven Holy Warrior rogue 13 / champion of Torm 10 / weapon master 17 (elf) by whirlin_merlin 
Born-Again Champion rogue 15 / champion of Torm 18 / weapon master 7 (elf) by BRIAN FELLOW 
Torm's Temple Guardian rogue 23 / champion of Torm 10 / weapon master 7 (human?) by Ocelott

And, of course, there's Valefor's SACRED PULVERIZER (Rogue 15/ Wm 7/ CoT 18) 

2 are Dex'ers and 2 are strength brutes. 

There are several R/F/CoT builds (that I'm not listing). Their intents might be similar to this build, but I haven't looked deeply at them yet. For instance:
Mick's Halfling Champion: Rogue 20/ Fighter 6/ CoT 14

My main desires in the build were TWF, Epic Dodge, and good saves. High crit range and some rogue bonus feats came along as I was laying it out. BTW...I always like Lore because I'm cheap and don't want to pay a merchant to identify stuff. 

edit: As I've been going thru refining the build, my goals and intentions have got a little clearer.
Strong desires:
- Rogue skills and bonus feats, especially Epic Dodge
- BAB@lvl20 > 15, TWF, ITWF for plenty of attacks per round
- Good to great saves (not sure I'm quite there, or if it's even possible with a rogue)
Secondary desires
- High crit range (hence the kukri in v1, tho I might go back to it for v3)

Problems I still see:
- Will save is lacking.
- Couldn't squeeze another Dex+1
- Sneak/crit immune enemies

Comments? Improvements? Free art to add?
_____________

From v1 to v2:
HP +12
skills -12
26/20/42 => 29/22/42
traps -1
v1 skill spread:
Disable Trap 40(44), Heal 11(10), Hide 19(30), Intimidate 4(4), Lore 43(45), Move Silently 30(41), Open Lock 40(51), Search 32(34), Set Trap 20(33), Spellcraft 20(22), Tumble 40(51), UMD 40(40)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Neat build idea MD, here's my thoughts after a very brief observation,
a) change cha(8) & str(10), helps with the load you can carry
b) change class-split to rog(19)-wm(7)-cot(14), +1 saves & 1 more epic feat
c) shuffle a bit your level order to take ED by level 30
d) modify a bit your skills to fall into correct values, such as: set trap (15), open lock (15), spellcraft (20), hide & move silently max them out, etc.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Echoing Valerfor, really, in terms of class split. Although I might take a different slant, and take 10 levels of CoT pre-epic so you can get Blind Fight or Knockdown, neither of which you have currently. Indeed, you could get both if you dropped kukri for shortsword or dagger. If you leave WM until epic levels, things might get a bit squashed, but it means there'll still be good stuff to be gleaned from those levels.

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:Neat build idea MD, here's my thoughts after a very brief observation,
Thanks :) I've been trying to think about what I haven't played or seen much of.
a) change cha(8) & str(10), helps with the load you can carry
I had it that way at one point, but I've never bothered to play a CoT before and I wasn't quite sure if having a negative CHA modifier would make his specials unusable like a wizard with an 11 INT. Plus I wasn't thinking too much about carrying capacity since I expected that whatever world this toon lands in, they'll be able to afford a few bags of holding.
b) change class-split to rog(19)-wm(7)-cot(14), +1 saves & 1 more epic feat
c) shuffle a bit your level order to take ED by level 30
See the original post for v2.
d) modify a bit your skills to fall into correct values, such as: set trap (15), open lock (15), spellcraft (20), hide & move silently max them out, etc.
Not sure that I have this 100% because I'm not convinced the leveling choices are quite optimal yet.
Stagmeister wrote:Echoing Valerfor, really, in terms of class split. Although I might take a different slant, and take 10 levels of CoT pre-epic so you can get Blind Fight or Knockdown, neither of which you have currently. Indeed, you could get both if you dropped kukri for shortsword or dagger. If you leave WM until epic levels, things might get a bit squashed, but it means there'll still be good stuff to be gleaned from those levels.
v2 has the 10 CoT levels pre-epic. By my count I gained 2 pre-epic feats and lose 2 epics. I also switched the build to WF:shortsword. I liked kukris because of the extra crit range, but it does stunt the build a little early on.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content: Version 2 lost crippling strike from what I can tell.  I think you should replace opportunist for that....wow I'd love it if this could take place earlier!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi MD, I know I prefer V2, but I have a couple of thoughts if that's okay? This one is personal preference, but I'd go for Crippling Strike over Opportunist. Secondly, Dex 33 doesn't really give you anything, so I might be tempted to drop the Great Dex at level 39 for Epic Prowess (so you'll keep the same AB, but defer the +1AC by 1 level), then take a different CoT bonus feat at 40, such as Improved Knockdown, even.

I've yet to have a proper go at the skills allocation (though I will, 'cause I'm like that), but everything feels better to me atm - congratulations!

Cheers

EDIT: Ninja'd by gkorjax - but glad to see there's at least two of us pro Crippling Strike!

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:Hi MD, I know I prefer V2, but I have a couple of thoughts if that's okay? This one is personal preference, but I'd go for Crippling Strike over Opportunist. Secondly, Dex 33 doesn't really give you anything, so I might be tempted to drop the Great Dex at level 39 for Epic Prowess (so you'll keep the same AB, but defer the +1AC by 1 level), then take a different CoT bonus feat at 40, such as Improved Knockdown, even.

I've yet to have a proper go at the skills allocation (though I will, 'cause I'm like that), but everything feels better to me atm - congratulations!

Cheers

EDIT: Ninja'd by gkorjax - but glad to see there's at least two of us pro Crippling Strike!
Thanks Stag and gkorjax. I agree with you on Crippling Strike, I'll blame a brain fart on its lose.
On to v3!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Much better MD, just a minor "fix",
After you take epic dodge (30), don't halt your progress but take all weapon master levels at once, you will then have wm (7) by level (33).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Interesting class split this!
Even though many members see me as a dexer builder, the only build I have made with these classes is a strenght based  rogue 13/CoT 8/ WM 19. So I really look forward to seeing what this ends up  with. 😊

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You know, this build is very interesting for the number of feats it needs, is the same in both it's dextrous & strength form.
You could replace weapon finesse with heavy armor proficiency, ambidexterity/ two-weapon fighting/ improved two-weapon fighting with power attack/ cleave/ great cleave & change the 18's position from dexterity to strength & have essentially the same basic plan for the build.
